fields.descriptive_line: Pageant procession featuring the Duke of Wurtemburg. Body-colour on joined vellum sheets.
fields.location: Prints & Drawings Study Room, level F, case 100, shelf A, box 10
Prints & Drawings Study Room, level F

fields.name: Prints & Drawings Study Room, level F

fields.bibliography: Victoria and Albert Museum, Department of Engraving, Illustration and Design & Department of Paintings, Accessions 1947, London: HMSO, 1950. The full text of the record is as follows: 'ANONYMOUS (Pageants) Grooms in pageant costume leading decorated saddle-horses. German, first quarter of 17th century. Body-colour and gold. Three sheets of vellum joined. E.239-1947 A pageant procession in which the Duke of Wurtemburg and his two brothers are the principal figures. Gentlemen and other attendants, mounted and on foot, represent various mythological and allegorical subjects; living birds and animals also form part of the procession. Inscribed in ink Premre. Entree de Mesigrs. le Duc et Princes de Wirrtemberg. Louis Frid. et Magnus Frid. a la Reception de Madame La Princesse Electce. pour courir la bagûe faitte a Heydelberg le 10 Juin 1614 (sic). Also with the names and titles of some of the figures represented, and with brief notes on the characters and subjects shown on the roll. Body-colour and gold. Eight sheets of vellum joined. E.240-1947 The Duke of Wurtemburg in mounted procession with his retunue, clad in armour with plumes and sashes, as if for a tournament. Among the retinue are trumpeters whose trumpet-banners carry the Duke's arms and name and are dated 1613. wo brothers are the principal figures. Gentlemen and other attendants, mounted and on foot, represent various mythological and allegorical subjects; living birds and animals also form part of the procession. Inscribed in ink Entree de Monsigr. Le Duc de Wirrtemberg pour le Tournoy de recontre en camp ouverts faitte a Heydelberg le 9 Juin 1614 (sic) A la reception de Madme. La Princess Electce. and on the back of the roll Entryes of Duke of Wirtemberg [......] cours of the feeld at her Highness [......] to Heidleberg An. 1614. (sic). Also with the names and titles of the gentlemen of the retinue. Body-colour and gold. Five sheets of vellum joined. E.241-1947 Note: According to the tradition of the family which formerly owned these pageant rolls, they were given to an ancestor by the Empress Palatine herself, on her return to England in 1661. This information would seem to support the evidence afforded by the inscriptions that these rolls do in fact depict part of the celebrations held at Heidelberg from 8 to 13 June 1613 in honour of the arrival there of the Elector Palatine, Frederick V, and his bride the Princess Elizabeth of England, daughter of James I. The accounts of the celebrations however, do not, however, describe any festivities which can positively be identified with those illustrated by these rolls. A description of the journey of the Princess across Holland and Germany, and of the festivities held at Heidelberg is given in English in The Magnificent Princely, and most Royall Entertainments given to the High and Mightie Prince, and Princesse... Together with a true Relation of all the Gifts, Presentations, Showes,.... etc printed by Nathaniel Butter, London, 1613. The festivities are also described and illustrated in Beschreibung der Reiss: Empfahung des Ritterlichen Ordens: Volbringung des Heyraths: und glücklicher Heimführung: .........des........Friederichen dess Fünften......mit der.......Princessin Elisabethen, printed by Gotthardt Vogelin at Heidelberg in 1613, the illustrations being in part by Johann Theodor de Bry, but nothing resembling the contents of these rolls appears there. Other relevant works are Kurtze Beschreibung/Desz zu Stutgarten/Ben den Fürstlichen Kindtauf und Hochzeit/Jungst-Gehaltenen Fremden-Fests/Verförtiget Durch Georg-Rodolfen Wekherlin. Tübingen/Ben Dieterich Werlin/Anno 1618, illustrated by M. Merian, and Repraesentatio der Fürstlichen Aufzug und Ritterspil. So der Durchleuchtig Hochgeborn Furst und Herr, Herr Johan Friderich Hertzog zu Würtemberg, und Teeckh......17 Martii 1616. Inn der Fürstlichen Haupt Statt Stuetgarten mit grosser Solennitet Gehalten.... Verfertiget Durch Esaiam van Hulsen, illustrated by M. Merian and B. Kuchler.'
